item.description:
This is the last big undeveloped land along the Connecticut coast. It was designated as a Costal Reserve to preserve and protect the wildlife and scenic features in an undisturbed state. There is a beach, views of the sound, and the foundation of a house that once belonged to Governor Winthrop. Bring a picnic lunch, and we will eat when we get back from our walk.

This will be an easy walk of about 3 miles with some easy up hills. Social walking pace. We will be out for 2 hours. Rain cancels. Dogs and children are welcome as long as they are calm and well behaved.

Location: 100 Depot Rd, Groton, CT. Go under the railroad underpass, and follow the road to the end. We will meet in the picnic area.
http://maps.google.co...

item.name: Bluff Point Walk, Groton, CT
